title: How to Make Spicy Fried Lady's Fingers

steps.headline: Wash them and pat them dry using a paper towel.
Cut the top and bottom section of the ladyfingers.
Cut a vertical slit in the middle of the ladyfingers.
Dice tomatoes, chop onions and coriander, and cut green chilies.
Put a frying pan on the stove and add 3–4 tablespoons (44.4–59.1 ml) of oil in the pan.
Add the ladyfingers and fry them until the stickiness is gone.
Remove the ladyfingers from pan and set aside.
In a different pan, add 2–3 tablespoons (29.6–44.4 ml) of oil, then add ginger garlic paste and lightly fry it.
Add chopped onions and fry until golden brown.
Add tomatoes and cook them until soft.
Add salt, chili powder, and ketchup and mix well.
steps.description: Then add the green chilies and mix again.

steps.headline: Add the ladyfingers and mix it together.
Squeeze some drops of lemon on the Lady Fingers.
Serve with fresh bread, naan, or rice.

text: Buy some fresh ladyfingers.  Wash them and pat them dry using a paper towel.  Cut the top and bottom section of the ladyfingers.  Cut a vertical slit in the middle of the ladyfingers.  Set them aside.  Dice tomatoes, chop onions and coriander, and cut green chilies.  Put a frying pan on the stove and add 3–4 tablespoons (44.4–59.1 ml) of oil in the pan.  Add the ladyfingers and fry them until the stickiness is gone.  Remove the ladyfingers from pan and set aside.  In a different pan, add 2–3 tablespoons (29.6–44.4 ml) of oil, then add ginger garlic paste and lightly fry it.  Add chopped onions and fry until golden brown.  Add tomatoes and cook them until soft.  Add salt, chili powder, and ketchup and mix well. Then add the green chilies and mix again. Add the ladyfingers and mix it together.  Transfer to a serving dish.  Squeeze some drops of lemon on the Lady Fingers.  Serve with fresh bread, naan, or rice.  Enjoy!
